data.text:
@EnemyInAState We don't need no education
https://t.co/20d9RfqRSS
@EnemyInAState My kids loved it. Lots of family time. 1:1 schooling. Still had loads of contact with friends via zoom & interactive games.
@EnemyInAState Chris, I love your tweets - but school isn't quite as bad as this! :) But I do get your point 😉

@mr_raiderMD @EnemyInAState It would be interesting to see the primary/secondary school breakdown. I bet a lot of primary kids missed school and all the interactions that come with it. Secondary school is a nightmare for many ... social pressures, academic stress, bullying etc.
@EnemyInAState Who wouldn't be happy with some half school day, fornite, and going on walks

@EnemyInAState Survey was done near the beginning of the pandemic when staying home still had some novelty value. They also included private school kids. Really hope they took care not to overweight the sample with those kids.

@EnemyInAState They surveyed the shires ‘Oxfordshire, Berkshire, Buckinghamshire, and Gloucestershire.’ Many kids in London live in tiny flats with no outdoor space and the playgrounds/ skate parks/ basketball hoops were roped off.
@EnemyInAState It's a very long time since I was a school age child, but I'm absolutely sure I'd have preferred lockdown to going to school for all those reasons.

@Andy180994131 @EnemyInAState In your previous tweet, you used data from the study to prove your case. Then in your most recent tweet, you state the study is biased - making your previous point redundant 🤣🤣. But sure, I'm the dumb one. Have a good day FirstNameBunchofNumbers.
